name: Despair
description: The main character wakes up in a tunnel of the subway and tries to find out that happened to it and other passengers of the train. To understand that after all it happened to the gone passengers, the player should investigate strange catacombs being deeply underground.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP / 7 / 8 Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo or AMD equivalent Memory: 2 MB RAM Graphics: DirectX9c compliant card with at least 1024MB of VRAM DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 2 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX9c compliant
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 SP1 64-bits Processor: Intel Core i3 or AMD equivalent Graphics: DirectX9c compliant card with at least 2048MB of VRAM DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 2 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX9c compliant

reviews.review_text: The true horrer beind this game is the quality
No custom controls, no explanation whatsoever, Russian text, cardboard textures; the only good thing about this game is that it immediately crashed and saved me from playing more of it.

The scariest thing in this game is the 'To be continued...' at the end. Please, no more.   ­­ Poor collision detection.   Movement is maddeningly sluggish.   Only about 15-20 minutes of gameplay at a brisk pace.   No checkpoints/saves.   Even with language set to English, the battery count text is still in Russian.   Playing fullscreen with a second monitor, the cursor would move to the other screen and clicks would minimize the game. When resuming the game, mouse look was non-functional.   Gameplay consists of not getting lost, solving one simple puzzle, and completing one short barrage of QTE.
This Game is Bad

I bought this game during the 2015 Summer Sale. Even bought it for a few friends.  It was on sale for 9 cents (US). Turns out, it was 10 cents too much. I figured at the very least, I could get 3 cards out of it. By the time I bought the game, Steam's new 'Two Hours before you get cards' rule had gone into effect.  This game should have come with the cards, automatically. The real Despair is that I had to idle this HORRIBLE game 2.7 hours to get the cards.   Some people have compared this game to the game   Bad Rats  . Please, don't insult   Bad Rats   by comparing this game to it. You can actually get some enjoyment out of   Bad Rats  .  I made multiple attempts to play this game. With each attempt, I became more irritated, and less enthused. If this game was free, it would still be too expensive.
Despair the game Despair price
Prepare to Despair.  Even though the price of this game is fair You really should not care. Because it's so bad you will pull out your hair.
1. Start the game 2. Let it run 3. Return to your desktop 4. Wait on trading cards 5. Close Game

Little noname sits alone in a subway, lights go out and the train crashes.  The story ends here after 20 seconds, but this is the exciting point where the game begins...  Summary: Detailed loading screen with a nice flash for 9 cent + trading cards... Awesome.   Little advice: - Close your eyes while playing the game ... improves the graphics immediately. - Never ... never change the audio-settings (Unless you dont need your ears anymore)
Worst game I've ever played

This was 10 cents. I buy it. Played it. Walked in tunnel. Stopped moving. Glitches. No Moving 4 me anymoar. Not even gonna alt+tab to get trading cards, such a waste.  My dead grandma codes better. It feels like something a high mexican would ♥♥♥♥ out. 10cents/MyLife would most defiantly not play again.
You run out of batteries for your light and then you just run around in darkness. No more being scared, just being frustrated. Fail.
If you are looking for bugs, this is your game. You can buy thousands of them for as low as 0.09€. You will not find anywhere else an offer like this!.
They told me this is a ♥♥♥♥ game and I said no. I told them this is not a game this is just a ♥♥♥♥.
Don't even try to actually play the damn game, it reminds a bit of 'AirControl'
This game: about 7 FPS. Other Games like Just Cause 2: About 32 FPS. 4 Minutes loading time, 2 Minutes Gameplay. 10/10.

Another generic horror game.  It tries to build up tension and be atmospheric, but what it really does is bore you with absolutly nothing happening.  To add to that, the movment is very sluggish, many areas look the same, and sometimes the objective is unclear, leaving you to spend what feels like an eternity walking in circles. The 'tension' it tries to create is followed by a slow, uneventful quicktime event sequence, where for some reason the you ran away from what looked like an fairly good looking girl.   Also, as for the biggest moment of fear, and despair in the game? Getting stuck in a dirty bathroom. Yuk.
I continously felt as if I was going to throw up during my play time.
Probably the worst game I have ever played
I made a new catagory in my steam library titled 'Cancer' just for this game!!!!
You can literally see where one unity asset pack ends and another one begins.
This game concentrates the feeling of desperation in a way that no game has done before.

Honestly, I bought this game on sale for 0.09€ just to sell the cards and make 0.09€ of pure profit out of it ;) Didn't even bother to play as there are no achievements to get. On the other hand, main menu looks terribly bad and I could barely manage to move the pointer to click the quit button... But still, I can't rate the gameplay, so I'll just make a positive recommendation for the cards :)

Bought this for no other reason than the fact that I noticed my work was used in the making of this game. Which is the Unity splash screen in the 'Trailer' that can be found on my devantart and youtube (Search 'Molten Metal Studios'). Otherwise I didn't enjoy this game, for a variety amount of reasons that could be summarized into three things. Bad mechanics/lack of. Not really detailed story and. Lack of any graphical quality. If you have none if not two in a game, it's going to be terrible like demonstrated here.  I don't know what to say though, I'm happy my work was used, but not due to the state of the game itself hahaha.

I see alot of mixed opinions about this game......   First of all the game is made in Unity. Which is good. However the developer has not put much thought or effort in the story line.  (I got this for free)   Pros  + Made with Unity, a very powerful engine if know how to use correctly. Take 'The Forest' for example.  Cons  - Dull - No graphics option - Not a real story line  Conclusion: With that game of a price tag, don't buy it. Instead buy an icecream!  0.5 / 10

Just poor. It's shocking that this has a mixed rating on Steam at time of writing. There is no two ways about it, this is poor and should be avoided. Everything about it screams out rushed and half finished, right down to the fact that your battery number indicator is still in Russian (playing English version). Graphics are pretty hideous, especially with the neon colours to indicate interactable objects. There is no guidance on what you're supposed to be doing and I found my way through based on blind luck. Overall it is a very poor attempt to build suspense and fear. At one stage, arguably the game's 'peak', you start to be chased, but I had the flashlight off at this stage, so I lose control of my character and off he runs into the darkness, and every now and then an 'E' symbol appears instructing me to press 'E'. From what I gathered, my character was pulling down stuff behind him to block the persuer but how on earth he could see where he's going is beyond me. Also the finale glitched up for me, and I ended up clipping through the scenery before the most comical out-of-nowhere 'THE END' appears onscreen. Watching youtube videos revealed I missed out on a cutscene but even with this new information I still had no idea what was going on. Just avoid, even if it is up for like 10p. Your time is more valuable.
the game is garbage 0/10 would fly plane into

Despair  Pros 1. Its extremely cheap 2. Gives you a reason to go outside and completely remove 2 GB from your hard drive  Cons 1. Horrible atomsphere 2. Awful Color Pallet 3. BOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOORING 4. No directions given 5. Was this supposed to be a horror game? 6.Russian subtitles in the English setting  Only buy as a troll

If this is the result of a teenage hobby project: Congrats for getting this far, keep learning.  If this acutally was a PAYED job of someone: Horrible and not in the 'horror game' sense of horrible, but in the 'holy ♥♥♥♥ this was bad'-sense.

This game was not worth the ¢9 I spent on it. I played for 11 minutes and already didn't know what to do,this game gives you no clear objective besides 'find out what happned' and nothing scary happned. This game is poorly optimized,not fun,and just badly made. if you enjoy horror games,do not buy this game.
My despair to this game.

The game opens to a boring, unskippable cutscene every time you open it. The game starts with a disorienting other cutscene that is also unskippable and goes on for way too long. The settings don't save when you change them. There are invisible walls and cheap deaths galore. I got this game for nine cents and I'm already regretting it. Steam Refunds, ho!
Bought this 9 cents quality adventurous game to play it but I went 'AFK unintentionally' Got 3 steam curds Sold them for 15 cents Profit?
You'll fall into despair if you play this

Main Character was a jolly ol' nut until he fell off a fence. Now, Main has to run through pyramids, dungeons, haunted houses, and abandoned train stations with only half a leg. He can barely escape from his wife, Evil Character, who loves chopping cacti with an axe. People say he's too slow, but in his mind, he's better than the average noodle. He has heart! And, that's all he needs to get through obstacles in life!  If only this game had a story like that, then I'd enjoy it a little more. 0/10

Worth Every Penny...all nine of them.   It was kind of scary. I guess. I can honestly say I could not make this game.   Graphics : 2/5  Sound: 2/5 Gameplay: 2/5 Overall: 2/5 D+  Someone spent a good amount of time putting this together and they made their first game. Thats pretty cool. I paid 9 cents so I am not out anything. I would say buy it because you'll have a nice chuckle at the lack of everything and things randomly being in Russian.   If you appreciate indie game devs and want to see people creating games, buy it. Do not expect the best game.   Pretend like a friend of yours who recently learned how to program and use Unity made a first person horror game...Thats what this is.
Pros: - Music - Scary plot - Quick time event - Price  Cons: - no cons  Best game ever 10/10

This game is a masterpiece. These graphics are the best I've ever seen, and the atmosphere was incredibly scary. The sense of fear given by flashlight battery running out has filled my pants with poop. I especially loved the ending. This game was incredibly dank. I tip my fedora 420 times to the creator(s) of this game. Would recommend if you don't hate yourself. 69/10

The best thing about playing Despair is that it makes me feel over-the-top powerful without sacrificing the fear of defeat. It’s got great free-flowing combat and a good-sized, good-looking open world full of spookies to find, but what makes it special is what’s going on in the background: an intriguing hierarchy of enemies that gives every victory and defeat extra meaning.A brief and shocking opening scene sets a dark and brutal tone as your charecter, is ritually executed along with his family. your charecter's spirit is then bound to an amnesiac ghost and returned to the subway for vengeance against the spookies forces. It’s a story that doesn’t make total sense for hardcore Bad Rat scholars, but it’s well-acted. It makes decent use of the controls, and there are a couple of memorable new characters - particularly badRat, the comic-relief ogre, who guides you through the process of infiltrating the enemy army.
Bought it for 0,09 € Downloaded and started it Felt no interest, so alt-tabed Got 3 card Sold them for 0,15 € Profit!
Game bugged - can not change batteries in flashlight, need to restart game, NAHHHH. Went see what's new on facebook while waiting card drop. 10/10
This game is possibly the best game ever! You don't even need to play it to win. You just leave it on when you go out, and you win the cards. 10/10 Absolutely breathtaking -IGN

Umm.... I was going to options... suddenly my mouse was invisible at the audio section. The loading is quite long too.. I really enjoy the blue line at the bottom border. Also a good thing there is an instruction manual, or tips or which button what does...... The game is totally not dark or something. you can see alot..... - try playing this game when the sun is shining in your room and you are watching the screen. If we have to call this a 'object hugger simulator, or a wall hugging simulator' then this will be on number 1. He jumps like a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ and even a turtle can beat him in a race when the guy is running. I quitted the game 6 mins later. Why? because it is way too dark. Even my hole isnt THAT DARK.  0/10
The Hat Man: Shadow Ward was the worst game i ever played. Then i Played this. My Mouse refuses to work only in this game. Payed .09, sold the cards for .28. Profit!

-Bought game for 9 pennies  -Lights go out -Blue Stamina Bar Depletes Fast -Weird train lighting glitch -Lights come back on -Die to train -Click New Game -Game crashed Computer Freezes -Kills Internet 10/10 would play again  Reopened game for some reason: -Turned into corridor -Flashlight -Vents -More vents -Too many vents -Change batterys, press b -Press B too many times and lose all batteries -Find exit to vents -Generic ladder noises -Get off ladder -Turn right -Fall through world Again would recommend
Please how much longer til I get that third trading card...
5 mins in. No light. Can't see a thing.  Screw this. I'm gonna play a real game.  10/10 this ♥♥♥♥ destroyed my life.

This game is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t to much RNG involved for a horror game you can get unlucky and have to be AFK in game for a very long time to get those steam trading cards.... But in overall once you get the cards i think the game is worth buying.
The perfect birthday gift for texans.
Very Good for make XP for upgrade profile Level

This game is basically First-person Unity horror game #5325. It's not scary at all, it doesn't even have jumpscares. Not to mention that its also very short, I managed to complete it in 15 minutes. I only recommended this game because you can earn profit by selling the cards.

Woke up in a train Left train Walked on the tracks for a while Found a warehouse found a note and a flashlight Need to travel inside of a vent As I was searching the warehouse I found a noose with an exit sign  I watch the noose for a while deciding if I should stop playing I perservere and find a basement with a generator  Turned it on and the lights came on I left to realize that it was only the basement lights Need to replace batteries  Don't have any batteries  Walk around in the dark See a glowing red door go into it Walk around in darkness Realize I am in a maze 10 mins of walking into walls See another glowing red door The loading screen has stairs leading to light so I get excited Enter new room and its completely dark Should've choose the noose Close the game Didn't get any cards Uninstall 10/10 would hang again

I dont think i can continue. I was once happy, but this game made me see darkness. Weeks have passed and i no longer feel the need for nurishment or enjoyment. I pass through these days like there is a void in my soul like there is nothing but the sweet release of death that will uplift me from the despair that i have endured. I lost all my money to this game, my wife left me and i am an outcast to my family. 10/10 IGN would ruin life again
You play as a man lost in the sewers searching for trading cards.

Is it just me or does this game really suck? I think I have won when the screen went black and white and the game ended. Will just alt-tab and try to at least get the trading cards.  Worst thing I've ever seen. The game was probably created in 5 minutes to take money from desperate players looking for some cheap entertainment.
'To be continued' on its next appeareance, the truest form unleashed !  The Greatest 'DESPAIR 2: The Search for profit in the cards'
Very atmospheric horror exploration game, graphics + effects are rather good, sadly it's too short (up to 1h gameplay). Buy it only on sale.

Main objectif of the game : find what happened, well it's gonna be easy. After finish the game : Still don't now what happened + epic action cinematic and camera angle. 11/10 Would play again (and i get ebola).

See. i could make a pun about how this game makes me want to 'despair'  but to put it quite honestly. these are the games that shouldnt make it out of greenlight. its not that the game is bad. not by a longshot. it has potential. but its not ready for any form of release. the graphical quality is subpar. and the player movement is poorly designed leaving characters making poor movements. and clunky motions.   if i was to leave a note to the developer it would go like this: your game is currently not in a state where it is 'playable' you should go back, work on the movement issues. and implement better models and better textures within your level design. as for the plot and gameplay. this is fine
Bought it for the cards, nothing else.

Very good indie project,I hope that the whole game will out soon.A couple of times I got a tingling.This 'demo' is short so I suggest you to wait full game.It took me 30 minutes to complete whole game.
i would give this to people that are afraid of spiders since theyre both not scary its more of a troll horror game
just for trading cards :)
1.bough the game 2.started the game  3.couldnt understand what happens 4.quit the game    89560/0 wood bang again
best $0.09 I've ever spent, because what else can you really get for that price in this day and age?
0/10 - never has a dev picked a more fitting name for his game  Terrible map design, terrible textures, terrible sounds, terrible lighting, the terrible never ends....

I feel like this game actually had a point at first, but as it progressed, the developer thought to himself, 'This is kinda hard.' then said screw it, and slapped a 'The End' on it literally about 15 minutes in. There's a building tension, but the moment there is a 'scare', you'll burst out laughing because a dead faced Michael Jackson moonwalks at you... Seriously, this game is terrible.  P.S. Paid 9 cents for it. Gained it back by selling the trading cards. Gained my money back, and then some.
Losh whole 0.07£ ... Thank you ! </3

Bought game. Left running for trading cards. Sold cards for profit.  10/10 would buy again. But not play.  Seriously, don't play it. It's the worst. If nothing else you'll want to rip someone's arms off because it feels like your character is wading through molasses as you walk.
Poor Graphics, Controls feel soggy and overall, the plot is a bit cliched in my opinion. The way to play this game is to just let it run and sell off the trading cards for a profit. 3/10

This game is at the perfect price point, $0.09. I would recommend this game at that price, I previously didn't know I was capable of squeling like a ♥♥♥♥♥. While the game was short, the atmosphere was well constructed and the 'plot' was scary although a bit short. Well worth my money and time. Me and a friend only encoutered one bug during the game, where you get stuck behind a shelf after pressing e on it forcing a restart of the game. Recommended for anyone in a safe, controlled enviroment.

I purchased this game on sale for 9 cents and sold the trading cards for 18 cents after steams reduction. I doubled my money and all i had to do was leave the game on over night. It is a great buy when it is on sale but as for the story or gameplay I cannot speak for.
very worth comerad. buy it for mother russias economy to save us from europe union and united staets. gr8 g8 m8

Steam's trading card function is literally PAYING YOU to play this game. That's how bad it is.   I am recommending it because I am a spiteful person and I want other people to 'Despair' at this game. Enjoy, sweethearts!
Crappy Game  but you get trading cards so you get your money back easy when its on sale for 9 cents

It's a playable game, as useuall nowheare near as bad as most the reviews state. the controlls aren't the best with lagging mouse, There isn't much content but you know it is a cheap game. I would call this more of a maze game than a horror. Ultimately though I got it on sale for £0.07 and ended up makeing £0.13 off the tradeing cards so I'm not going to complain.   I would recomment getting it while its on sale but wouldnt when it's at its normal price.
Just bought cus it was 9 cents and could make a few pennies profit by selling cards.

This game is the defenition of polish. I don't think I am worthy of its beauty. If you don't buy this game, you have not yet lived. I would recommend this game to all people who beleive that there are still games out there. I give this game 11/10. Game of the year, hands down beats Skyrim and GTA 5(Sarcasm).

This game is dark and the story of it is deep and bit scary it tells a story of somebody and something i really have no idea what the story wants to tell to player but its good.  Gameplay is good and graphics are nice.  And game is cheep. I would play it againg!!!

This game wouldn't even let me idle for cards. It crashed all the time when I tried to start it. And even if I WAS trying to play it, I couldn't because the game would crash before it could load the actual GAME for me. But from what I've seen, I am probably not missing out on much...

Your typical first unity fps. Partly russian language. Bland and empty level design. Entering level 2 there was no lighting anymore so I couldn't go on...
Unplayable with a good gaming pc. The Thumbnails looked better than the actual game itself.
Worse than Bad Rats.
I have half a mind to buy this game for everyone on my Friends List just to tick them off.
Didn't give me my trading cards as fast as I would have liked it to.
The scariest part of this whole game was the train that appears 5-6 minutes of being afk        10/10 would ride a train again...front row

This game is horrid. Not only does it lag extremely unless you play on the lowest setting, the loading screens take longer than those in skyrim. After playing for 5 minutes, random russian text suddenly popped up in the upper left corner, which was probably important information, but is not readable for the majority of the population of the world. The only reason why/time you would buy this game, is when it is on sale for a few cents and you like steam trading cards.

This is yet another ugly and disfunctional Unity based 'horror' game.  The movement and gameplay is unnecessarily slow, the cinematics and animations (or lack thereof) are awkward at best. There are no player models as far as I know, not even for holding a flashlight. User interface isn't much better - the elements of it don't have anything in common, some of it is represented by icons, some of it is in text (in Russian, while everything in English by default), and some of it might as well could be a loading bar. Generally the enviroment is revolting - mismatching, misaligned, obviously tiled textures, unexplained invisible walls and platforming elements which serve no purpose, or, better yet, non-solid objects. Additionally, everything looks the same, so getting lost in intentionally looped mazes along with low FOV (which can't be adjusted) makes a great recepie for nausea.  All in all, even the cost of 0,09€ is way too much for this, considering the profit one can get from the trading cards. You'd have to be in Despair to enjoy this game.
Dont Buy This Game If You Have 2 Screens But This Game Is Nah...
My favourite part was when I decided it wasn't very good so I decided to tab out and just sell the cards for more than the 9c I paid for the game in the first place.

Trying to play this game was a Despair...  - Lags on higher quality settings despite being a small game (less than 2 GB in size) - Mouse disappears when trying to adjust the audio - Nothing to really show you how to play the game - Some parts of the game were left untranslated leaving me to wonder what I am collecting and how many are left to collect - No real difference in quality settings aside from deciding how much the game will lag - Trying to play the game is a nightmare in and of itself - Very bland storyline - Slender-esque story....  On the plus side: - Only paid .09 for the game - Card drops - Can sell cards for profit - Or craft a level 5 badge really quick  Overall, would not buy or play again, awful, awful, awful and the creator of the game seems to have given no cares when making this game, nor did they bother to test if the game worked properly.

This game was an absolutely horrible experience for me. Even the 9c that I paid feels like too much. Lives up to it's title.  Cons: 1. Mouse was incredibly sluggish and even dissapeared from the screen while still in the menu (of course there's no setting to fix that). 2. Graphics looked absolutely horrible and not even close to what the images show (eventhough I meet minimum specifications, which feels too high for this junk anyways) 3. Doesn't look like it's optimised at all. Takes up way too much resources considering how little you can do in it.  Pros: Trading cards.
for 9 cents it was worth a try, it was very suspenseful i never knew what would happen, it is really short but i will show it to a few friends i guess
waste of nine cents

Even though I was (I'll admit) one of those users who bought the game for the cards, I was determined to play through it. The game, however, was determined not to let me.  Attempt 1: Got ran over by a train, game crashed when I tried to restart Attempt 2: Lights in the subway tunnel glitched out, game could not progress Attempt 3: Jumped into a fenced off room, could not escape, had to manually restart Attempt 4: Ghost lady made my flashlight glitch out and not let me install new batteries, was too dark to progress  10/10, would give up again  (what i did play though, there were like seven or eight spots that would've made the perfect jumpscare and not a single one was taken advantage of. atmosphere was pretty good in spots when ther was enough light to actually see. not enough to make me feel like my nine cents was well spent, however)
Aight.

I tried to give this game a chance. I figured the reviews may have been a bit harsh (and some of them are). Figured everyone was just hopping on the hate train and trying to figure out who could come up with the best insults in the reviews. But no, this is a really, really bad game. It might get a little more love if it was a free game on Newgrounds or Kongregate, but it's not. And there are pleanty of free games on those sites that are much better than this.
